`` Nobody is going to call me and say,` Hey, I want you to come and do halftime at the Super Bowl,'' says the poet, a huge football fan who once taught Michael Vick . But we'd ask Janet Jackson . When we look at poetry we have to say,` This is where we're at'... Poetry sits atop this pyramid, and we have given birth to another aspect of it when we look at rap and spoken word. Poetry also has a distinct advantage in an age of tweets and sound-bites.`` The brevity of a poem allows for the kind of fast-paced world we're in,'' Major Jackson says.``

NFL and its players union met for two hours in Dallas to talk about a new labor deal, their first formal bargaining session in more than two months. The sides issued a joint statement, saying they plan to increase the number, length and intensity of bargaining sessions so they can reach agreement before the collective bargaining agreement expires March 4. Jan. 23( Bloomberg)-- President Bush Secretary of State Colin Powell , a Republican who supported Democratic Barack Obama in the 2008 election, said he's not committed' to supporting Barack Obama or a specific Republican candidate in 2012.`` I'm not committed to Barack Obama , I'm not committed to a Republican candidate, Colin Powell , a retired Army general who was chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, said on CNN's`` State of the Union'' program today. Colin Powell said he won't decide whom to vote

X FACTOR boss Simon Cowell is trying to entice Britain's top voiceover man to America. Booming Peter Dickson, 49, is familiar to millions of fans for telling nervous contestants: It's time... to face... the music! Now Simon Cowell wants him to deliver his sound on the talent show's American version from the autumn. Peter, who also does Britain's Got Talent, Family Fortunes, The Paul O'Grady Show,

Bill Lockyer , California's state treasurer, participated in a national telephonic news conference with EPI officials, to denounce the bankruptcy concept. No state needs to declare bankruptcy, Bill Lockyer said,`` The states have sovereign taxing power the big companies don't.'' Bill Lockyer 's point-- a valid one-- is that bankruptcy is the refuge for individuals, corporations and local governments
